name:
Both kiddos have now tested negative. If they test negative tomorrow, after 48 hours from the first negative test, we should be good to go.

Lacey and I will get PCR tests tomorrow to hopefully confirm that we have made it through without getting infected.

Ready for this to be over!

name:
The time for an easily self-hosted personal CMS, designed around the Fediverse and IndieWeb is now.

No, I don’t mean hacking it into a legacy CMS like WordPress. It needs to be modern, and completely focused.

(The CMS I use, Known, had the right idea, about 5 years too early).

My website is essentially the prototype for it, but it is in no way accessible to folks, both from the server admin side or the user experience side. I have a long list of what I want to improve, but sadly never took the time to do it.

name:
So, I have a challenge. My son (9yo) started watching the One Piece anime on Netflix and really enjoys it. He wants to watch the rest of the series.

It seems that CrunchyRoll, the streaming service, is the way to get it, but they have next to zero parental controls, and the category is filled with adult content.

Any suggestions? Is there an alternative that I’m not aware of?

content.html:

name:
“A Very COVID Christmas™” has me stressed so I am making a pie. I have to say, as stress-vices go, pie is a pretty awesome one.

Apples. Bourbon. Cinnamon. Nutmeg. Vanilla. Honey. Brown sugar. A metric ass-ton of butter. Crumble topping.

🥧 🎅 🦠

We have a cursed Christmas, folks.

summary: @jonathanOh nooo!That means he had to have been infected before he even got on the plane, because there is a 3-5 day incubation period. If he wasn't wearing a mask, he probably infected others on the plane.When my daughter visits me, she gets a PCR test 3 days before coming here, and the day she leaves. She usually drives here, but if she flies, she wears a mask the entire time.This is why I won't travel on airplanes any more. #Covid covid

content.html:
@jonathan
Oh nooo!
That means he had to have been infected before he even got on the plane, because there is a 3-5 day incubation period. If he wasn't wearing a mask, he probably infected others on the plane.
When my daughter visits me, she gets a PCR test 3 days before coming here, and the day she leaves. She usually drives here, but if she flies, she wears a mask the entire time.
This is why I won't travel on airplanes any more. #Covid covid
content.value: @jonathanOh nooo!That means he had to have been infected before he even got on the plane, because there is a 3-5 day incubation period. If he wasn't wearing a mask, he probably infected others on the plane.When my daughter visits me, she gets a PCR test 3 days before coming here, and the day she leaves. She usually drives here, but if she flies, she wears a mask the entire time.This is why I won't travel on airplanes any more. #Covid covid

summary: @terihannigan yeah, he did a rapid before he left and it was negative, and was wearing an N95 respirator on the plane thankfully, which drastically reduces the risk for other passengers.When I fly, I test the two days before departure and mask in an N95. May need to shift my perspective to PCR tests before I travel.

content.html:
@terihannigan yeah, he did a rapid before he left and it was negative, and was wearing an N95 respirator on the plane thankfully, which drastically reduces the risk for other passengers.
When I fly, I test the two days before departure and mask in an N95. May need to shift my perspective to PCR tests before I travel.
content.value: @terihannigan yeah, he did a rapid before he left and it was negative, and was wearing an N95 respirator on the plane thankfully, which drastically reduces the risk for other passengers.When I fly, I test the two days before departure and mask in an N95. May need to shift my perspective to PCR tests before I travel.

name:
It really sucks they COVID came for our family Christmas. The kiddos haven’t seen their grandparents in ages and were so excited.

My daughter tested negative twice, and we thought we were clear, but got a positive test today, nine days from exposure. My son is still positive.

I’ve felt crappy today, but have tested negative twice.

name: The new home theater is really starting to get dialed in. With the ALR screen in place, the image from the projector is shockingly bright, crisp, and rich. Once I get the second subwoofer in, I’ll spend some time in Dirac Live tuning the audio to perfection.

content.html: The new home theater is really starting to get dialed in. With the ALR screen in place, the image from the projector is shockingly bright, crisp, and rich. Once I get the second subwoofer in, I’ll spend some time in Dirac Live tuning the audio to perfection.
content.value: The new home theater is really starting to get dialed in. With the ALR screen in place, the image from the projector is shockingly bright, crisp, and rich. Once I get the second subwoofer in, I’ll spend some time in Dirac Live tuning the audio to perfection.

name: My new subwoofer for the home theater died. It is under warranty and will be repaired, but it’s going to take a long time, so I used the opportunity to buy a second one. I’ll use it it’s own until the repaired one arrives, and then upgrade to dual subwoofers. Whee!

name:
My Steam Deck is lookin’ good. In addition to some awesome AAA titles (Spider-Man, Horizon, Uncharted, Cyberpunk), I have emulation dialed in from Sega Master System, NES, Genesis, SNES, Sega CD, Saturn, Dreamcast, PSP, GBA, NDS, 3DS, N64, PS1, PS2, PS3, Wii, WiiU, and even Switch.

One of my favorite tech gadgets in ages. Just amazing.
